revised_title: Differential Action of X-Rays on Tissue Growth and Vitality: Part I
tldr: The authors investigated the biological effects of homogeneous X-radiation on tissue growth and vitality using the chorio-allantoic membrane of the embryo chick. They discovered a selective action by different X-ray wavelengths, causing either hypertrophic or atrophic reactions in the tissue. This study provides insights into the potential applications of X-rays in cancer research and treatment.
